Operation 'put-/feature-flags/v3/{appId}/flags/{flagName}' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description uses a concrete example but lacks clarity about input/output details and side effects. Added explicit mention of: (1) what the FlagPutRequest contains, (2) what FlagResponse is returned, (3) whether this creates or updates, (4) the scope of impact (all instances), and (5) create-or-update behavior. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full lifecycle and effects.

data.current_description: Set a feature flag for an app. For example, update the `hs-hide-crm-cards` flag's `defaultState` to `ON` to hide classic CRM cards from new installs.
data.summary_suggestion: Update or create an app feature flag
data.description_suggestion: Creates or updates a feature flag for the specified app. Accepts a FlagPutRequest containing the flag configuration (e.g., setting `defaultState` to `ON` or `OFF`). Returns the updated FlagResponse with the new flag state. This operation affects the flag's behavior across all instances using this app. If the flag does not exist, it will be created; if it exists, it will be updated with the provided values.
data.reasoning: The current description uses a concrete example but lacks clarity about input/output details and side effects. Added explicit mention of: (1) what the FlagPutRequest contains, (2) what FlagResponse is returned, (3) whether this creates or updates, (4) the scope of impact (all instances), and (5) create-or-update behavior. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full lifecycle and effects.

message: Operation 'delete-/feature-flags/v3/{appId}/flags/{flagName}' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description lacks critical details about what happens after deletion and the destructive nature of the operation. Added: (1) explicit return behavior (200 status), (2) scope of impact (all instances), (3) warning about irreversibility, (4) guidance on when to use this operation. This helps AI agents understand the consequences and make informed decisions about when to invoke this operation.

data.current_description: Delete a feature flag in an app.  For example, delete the `hs-release-app-cards` flag after all accounts have been migrated.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete a feature flag from an app
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a feature flag from the specified app. This operation removes the flag definition and its state across all instances using this app. Returns a 200 status on successful deletion. Warning: This is a destructive operation that cannot be undone. Ensure the flag is no longer needed before deletion (e.g., after all accounts have migrated to new behavior).
data.reasoning: Original description lacks critical details about what happens after deletion and the destructive nature of the operation. Added: (1) explicit return behavior (200 status), (2) scope of impact (all instances), (3) warning about irreversibility, (4) guidance on when to use this operation. This helps AI agents understand the consequences and make informed decisions about when to invoke this operation.

Description lacks clarity about what is returned and the upsert behavior (create vs. update). Added details about batch processing semantics, return value expectations, and the create-or-update nature of the operation to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this endpoint.

data.current_description: Set the portal flag state for multiple HubSpot accounts at once. Use this endpoint to manage flag exposure for groups of HubSpot accounts.
data.description_suggestion: Set or update the portal flag state for multiple HubSpot accounts in a single request. This endpoint enables bulk management of feature flag exposure across account groups. Accepts a batch of account-flag state pairs and returns the results of each upsert operation. Existing flag states are updated; new states are created.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity about what is returned and the upsert behavior (create vs. update). Added details about batch processing semantics, return value expectations, and the create-or-update nature of the operation to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this endpoint.

data.current_summary: Retrieve accounts with a set flag state
data.current_description: Retrieve a list of HubSpot accounts with an account-level flag setting for the specified app. No request body is included.
data.summary_suggestion: List HubSpot accounts with flag state configured
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve a paginated list of HubSpot accounts that have an account-level flag state configured for the specified feature flag. Returns account identifiers and their corresponding flag states. Supports filtering and pagination via query parameters.
data.reasoning: Summary is ambiguous about whether it retrieves accounts with a specific state or any configured state. Description lacks details about pagination, filtering capabilities, and return structure. Enhanced to clarify the retrieval scope and response format for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Specify an account-level flag state for a specific HubSpot account.
data.description_suggestion: Set or update the account-level flag state for a specific HubSpot account. Accepts a flag state value in the request body and applies it to the specified account. Returns the updated flag state. If the account has no prior flag state, one is created; existing states are replaced.
data.reasoning: Description is vague about what constitutes the input (flag state value), what is returned, and the create-or-replace semantics. Added clarity about request body expectations, return value, and state management behavior to help AI agents understand the operation's effects and when to use it.

data.current_description: Delete an account-level flag state for multiple HubSpot accounts at once. Use this endpoint to manage flag exposure for groups of HubSpot accounts.
data.description_suggestion: Delete account-level flag states for multiple HubSpot accounts in a single request. Accepts a batch of account identifiers and removes their flag configurations, reverting each to default behavior. Returns the results of each deletion operation. This operation is idempotent.
